section.title: XML
section.paragraph: MTS 2.0 themes are written in XML, or eXtensible Markup Language. Advanced knowledge of XML is not needed when dealing with an MTS theme but you should have at least some basic knowledge of XML syntax to avoid parsing errors. Listed below are two excellent resources for general information about XML.

section.title: Basic Format
section.paragraph: Every theme should start with two basic elements; the XML declaration and the MTS root element.
The XML encoding may be changed if you wish, however ISO-8859-1 has been found to work well.
The rest of the theme should appear between the opening and closing 'mts' tags. Placing elements or data elsewhere in the file will likely generate errors.
